channel.title: Text-Based Society Progress Thread
channel.description:
Thanks to Flame for the idea of creating a text-based society.
I plan on going pretty in depth with this project to get the hang of java's packaging system and the overall reason to grasp the language a bit better. I'm trying to start off pretty organized, so I created quite a bit of packages and classes. I was going to put my main method in the Extremity class. When this program is initialized, I want it to have a list of facts, based on the data that I put into the class files, that update every minute. In the future, I want this program to somehow 'run behind the scenes' so it can accumulate overtime and see how my economy ends up!
Here's the packaging system I'v come up with.
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/1tapus.png[/img]
**and yes, I know I spelled Birth rate wrong, it has already been changed.
If you have any ideas on a better way to organize, or even some general tips you would like to share, feel free to let me know! Thank you.

item.title: Text-Based Society Progress Thread
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:4, topic:537047”]I don’t like the package naming.
Very misleading.[/quote]
I agree, but at least this provides ground for him to rework his design.

Read full topic

item.title: Text-Based Society Progress Thread
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Int Bauk, post:2, topic:537047”]food.animals and having classes with their product???

food.animals > Chicken, Cow, Pig, Deer

then have something like food.animals.product or impl[/quote]
Or you could simply just create a variable in the animal’s class which indicates certain properties of the animal: biomes, aggression, product, etc.

Read full topic
